title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: At the corner where itreceives the road winding steeply down the hill from Bemersyde, onepauses to see in imagination the black procession descend, withchamping bits and waving plumes and glittering harness, which inSeptember, 1832, bore by this route to their last resting-place the oncepowerful frame and generous brain of the great Wizard of the North.
